abstract: Ted Hakey Jr, Connecticut man who fired rifle at empty Baitul Aman Mosque near his home in Meriden, Conn, following Paris attacks in November 2015, is expected to plead guilty to federal hate crime.

headline.print_headline: Guilty Plea for Firing Gun at a Mosque
headline.main: Man Who Shot at Connecticut Mosque Is to Plead Guilty to Hate Crime

snippet: The authorities say the man, Ted Hakey Jr., fired a rifle at the empty Baitul Aman Mosque in Meriden shortly after the Paris terrorist attacks in November.
lead_paragraph: The authorities say the man, Ted Hakey Jr., fired a rifle at the empty Baitul Aman Mosque in Meriden shortly after the Paris terrorist attacks in November.
